isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER, GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 9800 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER GAUGES AND ODOMETER

svcsubproc.title: Remove Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges and Odometer
svcsubproc.para: The speedometer and tachometer unit consists of four serviceable (replaceable) components: speedometer, tachometer, odometer and unit housing, which includes the printed circuit board. To disassemble the unit and gain access the components:

step1.para: Remove six screws ( Figure 4): two on top, two on bottom, and one on each end.
Lift off the face plate to access the three meters.
The speedometer and tachometer each mount on four pins. To remove either gauge, grip the edges of the gauge face plate and lift directly away from the housing.
To remove the odometer, first remove the speedometer gauge. Disconnect the odometer from the printed circuit at connector J1. Remove two screws from back of cluster that retain the odometer and clip.
Position the odometer in the housing and install and tighten the two mounting screws. Connect the odometer lead to the J1 pins ( Figure 4).

The speedometer/tachometer gauges are plug-in type gauges. To install, grasp the gauge by the edge of the dial face. Align the four gauge pins to the circuit board terminal openings and gently push into place. The gauge case is non-conductive material so that if power were applied, the case will not short out the pins.
Position housing face plate, insert the six screws, and tighten.
